title: Fantasy
disclaimer: Eternalore demo. This is an imitation of the actual product.

base.text: Lanterns sway in the night breeze, painting the village square with flickering gold and crimson. Drums echo in steady rhythm, joined by pipes and laughter. Masked dancers whirl past you, their steps strangely precise—as if the dance has been rehearsed for centuries. You feel the pull of the music, deeper and deeper, toward the heart of the festival.

variant.text: You linger at the edge, watching the dancers’ steps. They are beautiful, yet unsettling—too precise, as though rehearsed for too long. The drums quicken. The masks no longer look playful—sharp teeth, hollow eyes, painted smiles too wide. A villager leans close, whispering through their mask: ‘It begins.’ The crowd’s laughter falters, replaced by low chanting beneath the music. Your chest tightens. Are you still a guest here—or the offering?

choices.label: Step back toward the edge of the festival

variant.text: You feel the press of the crowd behind you, blocking escape. The dancers encircle you, their steps pounding in unison. At the center of the square rises a stone altar, carved with glowing runes. No matter where you turn, the circle closes tighter. Hands press at your back, guiding, forcing—until you stand before the altar. The chanting rises, and you realize every masked face is turned toward you.

Hands grip harder at your arms, forcing you forward. Symbols blaze to life beneath your feet, burning lines into the earth. Energy surges upward, searing through your veins. Pain and power entwine—you stumble, caught between falling and floating. The chanting crescendos, louder, faster, until the sound drowns everything else. The ritual is no longer around you. It is inside you.
